text:
Dirty little secret about Microsoft staff people. More often than not, they
know what we want but they have to make a case for changes. So she's asking for
customer examples. 
"Working to help IT Admins manage Windows Updates with the Windows Insider
Program for Business, Windows Update for Business, and WSUS. My opinions are
mine!"
That's Aria Carley 
The Windows Update policies you should set and why - Microsoft Community Hub
 
[https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/359757i887BDFBF5227762D/image-size/original?v=v2&px=-1]

The Windows Update policies you should set and why

Explore this go-to policy resource to the best update policies for single-user,
multi-user, education, kiosk, and other types of devices. 
techcommunity.microsoft.com

metadata.email_text_original:
Re: Do you look at update logs? 
Dirty little secret about Microsoft staff people.  More often than not, they
know what we want but they have to make a case for changes.  So she's asking for
customer examples. 
"Working to help IT Admins manage Windows Updates with the Windows Insider
Program for Business, Windows Update for Business, and WSUS. My opinions are
mine!"
That's Aria Carley
